examples: The jury is still out as concerns the location of the new station.
She unfolded the map to find the location of the tourist attractions.
Having 3 locations in the same area creates a situation that the left doesn't know what the right hand is doing.
Whenever a celebrity is spotted in town, fans make a beeline for the location, hoping to catch a glimpse or snap a photo.
I used my finger to point at the map and show them the location.
words.defineEn: the geographic position of someone or something
words.defineVi: vị trí địa lý của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: The wind has changed direction.
Finally things are moving in the right direction.
We followed the map's directions to reach the hiking trail.
These directions are plain as a pikestaff, so you shouldn't have any questions.
These directions are as clear as a bell, so you shouldn't have any questions.
words.defineEn: the position that someone or something faces, points, or moves toward
words.defineVi: vị trí mà ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó phải đối mặt, chỉ hoặc di chuyển về phía

examples: Right, pin back your ears, everyone.
That extension is busy right now.
I want a dish of creamy mushroom bucatini with Parmesan right now.
Right by holding the candle to the devil.
After the traffic lights, turn right.
words.defineEn: the direction or side that is toward the east when someone or something is facing north
words.defineVi: hướng hoặc mặt hướng về phía đông khi ai đó hoặc thứ gì đó hướng về phía bắc

examples: To hear both sides of the argument.
His arms dropped limply to his sides.
The manager played his strongest side of the season.
On the credit side, the restaurant offers a wide range of choices.
The restaurant served their fish and chips with a side of brown sauce.
words.defineEn: the right or left half of an object, place, or surface
words.defineVi: nửa bên phải hoặc bên trái của một đối tượng, địa điểm hoặc bề mặt

examples: The children skipped stones across the calm river surface.
The majestic horse galloped across the open field.
The general had to get his troops across the river.
The carpet only reached halfway across the room.
They pushed the heavy box across the room.
words.defineEn: on the opposite or other side of a thing or place
words.defineVi: ở phía đối diện hoặc phía bên kia của một điều hoặc địa điểm

examples: The children scarfed down the pizza at the birthday party.
Turn the mould upside down.
His parents are always breathing down his neck.
That song always sends a shiver down my spine.
A path led down the hill.
words.defineEn: at or toward a lower level or position
words.defineVi: tại hoặc hướng tới một mức độ thấp hơn hoặc vị trí

examples: Cobbled streets run down to a tiny harbor.
The new smartphone is streets ahead of its predecessor, with a larger screen and more powerful processor.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
The street vendor served crispy trotter bites with a tangy dipping sauce at the food market.
The protesters raised their cries for justice and equality in the streets.
words.defineEn: a public path for vehicles in a village, town, or city, usually with buildings, houses, etc. on its sides
words.defineVi: một con đường công cộng dành cho các phương tiện trong một ngôi làng, thị trấn hoặc thành phố, thường có các tòa nhà, nhà ở, v.v. ở hai bên

words.defineEn: in a really short distance to a person or thing
words.defineVi: trong một khoảng cách thực sự ngắn với một người hoặc vật

examples: Trains between London and Brighton run throughout the day.
Responsibility is shared between parents and teachers.
This collection of stories bridges the gap between history and fiction.
This book bridges a gulf between the metaphysics literature and philosophy of mind literature.
His incorrect translation of the phrase caused a misunderstanding between the two parties.
words.defineEn: in, into, or at the space that is separating two things, places, or people
words.defineVi: trong, vào hoặc tại không gian ngăn cách hai sự vật, địa điểm hoặc con người

examples: The sunflower turned its face towards the sun.
The victory turned the tide of the war in North Africa.
The thunder had turned the milk.
Police turned water cannon on the rioters.
Turn the mould upside down.
words.defineEn: to move in a circular direction around a fixed line or point
words.defineVi: di chuyển theo hướng tròn xung quanh một đường hoặc điểm cố định

examples: I've got two left feet!
She turned the wheel sharply to the left.
I got a sudden pain in my left eye.
The left didn't know what the right was doing in this gross teen horror comedy.
On the left the ground drops away, giving a view over the rooftops.
words.defineEn: toward or located on the same side as the heart of most people
words.defineVi: hướng tới hoặc nằm cùng phía với trái tim của hầu hết mọi người

examples: The Siemens display goes the whole hog.
The cruise went very quickly.
My laptop went haywire
To go swimming/fishing/jogging.
The email went to everyone in the company.
words.defineEn: to travel or move from one location to another location
words.defineVi: để đi du lịch hoặc di chuyển từ một địa điểm đến một địa điểm khác

examples: A true leader walks the talk.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
The father proudly walked his daughter down the aisle on her wedding day.
They walk their dogs every day.
She walked the horse around the ring.
words.defineEn: to move forward at a regular speed by placing our feet in front of each other one by one
words.defineVi: di chuyển về phía trước với tốc độ đều đặn bằng cách đặt chân của chúng ta trước mặt nhau từng cái một

examples: Troops drove out the demonstrators.
Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.
A stream of black cars drove by.
A stream of black cars drove by.
The waves drove against the shore.
words.defineEn: to control the movement and the speed of a car, bus, truck, etc. when it is moving
words.defineVi: để kiểm soát chuyển động và tốc độ của ô tô, xe buýt, xe tải, v.v. khi nó đang di chuyển

examples: The clouds blocked the sun, creating a momentary shadow.
The train station is just a few blocks to the east of here.
The new office block has become an expensive white elephant.
Marco Silva has his head on the block at the moment.
She always puts her neck on the block by telling lies.
words.defineEn: an area in a city or town that contains several buildings and is surrounded by four streets
words.defineVi: một khu vực trong thành phố hoặc thị trấn có nhiều tòa nhà và được bao quanh bởi bốn đường phố

examples: We can't say it's impossible until we've explored all avenues.
They're using avenues like TikTok.
And because of that avenue, you've seen a shrinkage of the public markets.
There are legal avenues to enter our country.
if you have, if you, pursue the proper avenues.
words.defineEn: a wide straight street in a town or a city, usually with buildings and trees on both sides
words.defineVi: một con đường thẳng rộng trong thị trấn hoặc thành phố, thường có các tòa nhà và cây cối ở cả hai bên
